main event: Several unidentified targets were tracked by radar over Calumet, Michigan and Lake Superior area on 12 August 1953.
interesting points: The radar detected targets moving at speeds ranging from 100 mph to 600 mph., Targets shifted altitude from 6,000 ft to 21,000 ft in seconds., Observation lasted for 27 minutes., The targets were initially believed to be interference from aircraft electronics or cosmic noise., No visual or auditory observations were made during the radar tracking.
